dialogues.text: Hey, T, still friends, right? Tony smiles and heads out. Marty sits down at his desk. There's no way he's going to be able to keep this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beats of the investigation: - The fax machine spits out Ann and Chris' bank records. watch.as their old checks come out. dialogues.speaker: MARTY

dialogues.text: Nah, they're not gonna be able to check it out for another hour. (beat) Holy shit, Marty, you should see the rack on this chick who just walked by. Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: dust call me when you got something. Marty SLAMS the phone down. He hears a BEEPING o.s. Looks over.  ov It's the fax machine. Marty bolts for the fax machine.

dialogues.text: Those the phone records? Marty shakes his head "No." Taps his feet as the phone records come through... He grabs the phone records. Runs into his office.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (yelling) Baste, I'm feeling unloved. Where are my phone records?!

dialogues.speaker: MARTY'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Marty stares at the phone records. "248-234-5853 - Walsh, Martin A." all over the bill. "248-234-4000 - Quicho Police Department" numerous times. He fires up his computer. Looks out at the bullpen.

dialogues.speaker: BASTE
dialogues.text: (to Alex) : He said he faxed 'em over. I'll call him again. Baste, pissed, picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Marty scans the last page of the records into his compute COMPUTER: The phone records are on the screen. Marty copies and pastes non-incriminating numbers over hi But it's a slow process... He has to do it one number at a time. Alex runs in.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I need your computer for a séc.  on tw

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Gimme a couple a minutes.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: They e-mailed me a bunch of warrants.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Five minutes. Marty steals a look at Baste. BASTE: Talks on the phone as he gestures to the fax machi

dialogues.speaker: BASTE
dialogues.text: I'm staring at the god damn fax machine. They're not here. Just send 'em again... MARTY: Sees Baste hang up the phone. He continues to Copy and paste one number at a time. Alex walks over to Marty, glances at the computer... COMPUTER: A blank document. =

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You got writer's block?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I've got to do a report.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: For what? Somebody jaywalking? (beat) I need to get these warrants. You know, for this little double murder case we're working. MARTY'S POV: Baste stands vigilantly above the fax machin

dialogues.speaker: MARTY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: A couple minutes, alright? The fax machine BEEPS, starts up. MARTY: Starting to sweat.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I just don't-- Marty stands up, gets in Alex's face.  oy oo

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Five minutes! {calming down) Just gimme a couple minutes, alright?

dialogues.speaker: BASTE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (calling out) Phone records coming in. Alex gives Marty a look, then heads over to the fax machi FAX MACHINE: A "Bell Atlantic" cover page drops into the

dialogues.speaker: BASTE
dialogues.text: Shit. FAX MACHINE: "Out of Paper" flashes. MARTY: Working the keyboard like a stenographer. At his feet is a stack of paper.

dialogues.speaker: BASTE
dialogues.text: (calling to Marty) Where the hell's the paper? Marty ignores hii COMPUTER: "248-234-5853 - Walsh, Martin A" replaced by... "248-234-5100" - House of Pizza.” Marty's phone numbers are disappearing... But not fast enough. BASTE AND ALEX: Both looking for the paper. Baste grabs some paper from the printer. MARTY: Copying and pasting blocks of numbers now... No time to do it one number at a time. Marty deletes the last couple pages of records. BASTE: Trying to figure out how to load the paper. COMPUTER: Marty loads the fax program. BASTE: Slams the paper drawer shut. The fax BEEPS, comes to life. COMPUTER SCREEN: Marty hits "fax." That annoying Microsoft hourglass appears. The sand starts flowing down... MARTY: Bolts out of his chair. Runs over to the fax machine. FAX MACHINE: The 2nd page starts to print.  oy o

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Here. You gotta wiggle ita little.

dialogues.speaker: BASTE
dialogues.text: No, it's fine. Marty shakes the fax machine... "Accidentally" pulling out the cord. WAAH! The fax stops dead... the second page half-printed.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Shit. Marty grabs the half-printed second page. Tosses it into the trash. He plugs the fax machine back in. CONTROL PANEL: "2 faxes in memory." MARTY: On the sly, hits the "DELETE' BUTTON. CONTROL PANEL: "Delete first fax?" Marty hits "YES." The fax starts printing again... Marty glances at the control panel. CONTROL PANEL: "Receiving - Quicho Police Department." Marty covers the control panel with a box of paperclips. Marty walks into his office.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: He grabs the phone, dials a number.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Any word, T?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: They should have 'em in fifteen minutes or so.

dialogues.speaker: BASTE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: They're coming through.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Alright, let me know. Marty sprints into the bullpen.

dialogues.speaker: BULLPEN
dialogues.text: Alex grabs the "phone records" off the fax machine.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (off fax) What's this? I can't read this.  Ov uw Marty's alterations have made the phone records barely le

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (to Baste) Tell 'em to fax ‘em again. Baste picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: No, no. It's our fax. Toner's all screwed up. (off records) This one's Charlie Maroni, he's been friends with Chris since high school...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chae walks into the police station, carrying a folder. Marty and Alex look over the "phone records." Behind them, the fax machine chirps.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: The last call they made was to American Airlines at eight PM. Chae hums the "Dragnet" theme.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: The prom King and Queen were already dead when somebody made smores out of ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What? He hands her the autopsy report.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: No sign of smoke in their lungs. If they'd been alive when that place went up, their Lungs would look like a tobacco lobbyist's. Alex looks over the report. Marty sidles over to Chae.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (whispering) I gotta talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: BASTE
dialogues.text: Detective... Baste hands Alex a piece of paper.  Oy Ov

dialogues.speaker: BASTE
dialogues.text: Here's the cell phone calls. MARTY: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: "Cell phone calls?"

dialogues.speaker: BASTE
dialogues.text: Yeah, they're on a different database than land lines. CELL PHONE RECORDS: Top two entries read: "248-234-3494 - Town of Quicho - 12:23 AM." "248-234-3494 - Town of Quicho - 12:18 AM."

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (off records)
CHAE: He knows that number. His eyes lock with Marty's: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (excited) What time did that old lady say--

dialogues.speaker: BASTE
dialogues.text: Tt was at the end of Leno. Alex starts to dial the cell phone number on the speakerp Marty tries to conceal his terror. Knows that his phone will ring in one second. He turns away from Alex. Slips out his cell phone... Starts scrolling through the functions... Trying to find the RINGER option... Alex's call goes through. The speakerphone starts RINGING. MARTY'S CELL PHONE: Marty's on the ringer function. Marty's cell phone starts to RING. Marty scrolls to "VIBRATE"... The phone stops ringing mid-ring. SPEAKERPHONE: Continues to RING. Marty "answers" his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY, (INTO CELL PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yeah, hi. Hold on a sec. The connection's going out. SPEAKERPHONE: Second RING.  On MARTY'S CELL PHONE: Marty scrolls through the options... "PHONEBOOK"... "PAGER"... e SPEAKERPHONE: Third RING. MARTY:!S CELL PHONE: 'VOICEMAIL'... SPEAKERPHONE: The fourth RING... The CLICK as the call is forwarded to voicemail. MARTY'S CELL PHONE: Marty hits 'OFF' on voicemail.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: That better?... Yeah, I don't know about fishing tomorrow...

dialogues.speaker: SPEAKERPHONE
dialogues.text: (recording) The cellular customer you've called is either unavailable or has traveled outside the calling area...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Shit! She hangs up the phone. @ Marty continues "talking" on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: BASTE
dialogues.text: (off records) They must work for the town.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (to Marty) How do we find out who's assigned to this phone?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's kind of crazy here. Let me call you back. (hangs up, then to Alex) I don't know. I'11 call over to town hall.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What's the number, I'll call.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Ah, ah... Gimme a sec. I'11 look it up.

dialogues.speaker: BASTE
dialogues.text: e Here it is. Baste points to a list of numbers by the phone.  oy o (off Accounting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex starts to dial the number. CHAE: Watching this... Sees Marty's sweating. Chae reaches over, hangs up Alex's phone. Everyone,

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: It's mine.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What is?

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: The phone. It's mine. including Marty, looks at Chae, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Your phone? I thought you're County-- —

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: I work as a paramedic in town part time. Football games, school stuff... The phone's supposed to be for business. Alex absorbs this. Alex nods,

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: I was trying to call Chris last night.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: I was over at the Crowbar. I wanted him to meet me for a couple drinks. taking this in.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You're friends with him?

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: Sure. Drinking buddies. (beat) I would've mentioned it earlier, but, uh... (more)  oy wo CHAE (cont'd) (chuckles) To be honest with you, I don't remember all that much about last night.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: So you were at a bar?

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: I, ah, closed down the Crowbar and then went home with a "friend" of mine. Valerie Hanson...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Where's she live?

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: Over in Fallbrook.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Number?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: And she'll say you were there all night?

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: Yeah, because I was. Alex looks Chae up and down, doesn't believe he killed th

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You should've told me about this at the scene.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: And I would've if I didn't have about fifteen drinks last night.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I need a statement.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: Do it for you right now. Chae follows Alex into an office. Marty watches them go, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chae walks in, shuts the door.  What the--

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I was sleeping with her. Not what Chae was expecting.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: Jesus... (shakes his head) So you didn't-- (makes explosion sound) Marty shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: The whole thing, them moving back to town. It was all part of their plan. ~

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: Hold on -- "plan?" Marty hesitates for a second.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I gave her the Sarcetti money. Chae stares at him in disbelief for a long beat. Shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. (beat, laughs) Would you have given it to me if I fucked you?

dialogues.speaker: BULLPEN
dialogues.text: Alex looks at the autopsy report. Glances over at Marty's office. Marty and Chae still talking.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: There's no trace of the money? Marty shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: Christ, and I thought I had trouble with women. Chae looks out at the bullpen, takes in the investigation Notices a copy of the sketch of "Marty."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: sk They were pret hair. etch) ty generous with the Marty. laughs wearily.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: And you don't think you can explain the whole thing?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (counting on his fingers) Let's see, motive: I'm the beneficiary on her million dollar life insurance. Opportunity: they've got an eyewitness who saw me at her house right before it blew up. Should I go on? .

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: How's your alibi?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Home, by myself.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: That good, huh? Chae stares out at the bullpen for a beat. Marty's phone rings. He grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: They matched the prints on that thing. The guy's name is "Paul Cabot." They got his prints from his military file.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: You got an address?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Thirty-six Fiske Road, Magaway. Marty scrawls down the address.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Good job, T. . (to Chae) Wanna take a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty and Chae drive through Magaway, a small suburb. Marty scans the addresses on the houses.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: There! That's it. Chae screeches to a halt in front of a dilapidated duplex

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty tries the door. It's locked. He smashes a window, fishes his hand through the glass. Pops the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's home. Marty and Chae rifle through the apartment. Marty grabs a photo off of the wall. PHOTO: Ann, Chris, and Frieland (5 years ago). They're grinning, looking like the best of friends. Marty stares at the photo for a long beat. Ann's smile taunts him. .

dialogues.speaker: CHAE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, what tangled webs we weave... Marty tosses the photo to the ground. Goes over to Chae. Chae holds a work ID from Detroit Mercy Hospital. The name reads "Paul Cabot - X-ray technician"... But the picture is of Dr. Frieland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chae drives as Marty stares at Frieland's hospital ID. Chae slams on the brakes, comes to a dead stop.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: What the hell?! Chae points out two road signs. The signs point in opposite directions. One reads "Quicho - 1 mile"... The other reads "Canadian Border - 85 miles."

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: Canada's nice this time of year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Canada's never nice. (beat) You think I'm that fucked?

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: It's the bottom of the ninth and you're down by a lot of runs. (beat) And I've seen you play softball.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I'm glad you still have your sense of humor.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: I've got a couple grand. It'll get you down to Costa Rica. You could scout out some boats for us.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: 'Preciate the offer.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: Of course, the vig's twenty points. If you're late with the payments, it gets tacked on to the principal.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Of course. (beat) But I'm not running.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: Well, the idea was that I'd drive you.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: You want to drive me somewhere? Drive me back ‘to the station.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: I'll cut the vig to ten points. Marty shakes his head. Chae sighs, then heads for Quicho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Baste are huddled over a speakerphone.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (singing with hold music) "If you like being a pina colada"-- Marty walks in.  we Heads over to Alex.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (to Marty) We got the insurance company on the line. The hold music stops. Marty looks around, measuring the odds. No way he's going to fight his way out of here.

dialogues.speaker: EQUITY LIFE OPERATOR
dialogues.text: That policy number corresponds to a one million dollar term life insurance policy for an Ann Harrison. Marty edges toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: A million bucks?! (beat) — Who's the beneficiary?

dialogues.speaker: EQUITY LIFE OPERATOR
dialogues.text: One moment... He opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: EQUITY LIFE OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Ah, here it is. The beneficiary is listed as... Marty is out the door.

dialogues.speaker: EQUITY LIFE OPERATOR
dialogues.text: ...Chris Harrison, her husband.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Shit! Marty breathes a huge sigh of relief. Alex notices him at the door.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Where the hell you going now? Marty walks back over to her.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Get some air. It's stuffy in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, wait--

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EQUITY LIFE OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Got a note here. It seems the policy holder requested a form to change the beneficiary last week.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: She changed it?

dialogues.speaker: EQUITY LIFE OPERATOR
dialogues.text: If she did, it hasn't made it into our system.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You mean it might be in the mail?

dialogues.speaker: EQUITY LIFE OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Or it could be downstairs in our processing center waiting to be--

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Processed?

dialogues.speaker: EQUITY LIFE OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Can you connect me to the rocessing center?

dialogues.speaker: EQUITY LIFE OPERATOR
dialogues.text: They're closed on Saturdays.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Well get me someone who can open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECURITY GUARD flicks on the lights. Four pissed-off PROCESSING CLERKS walk in. They take their seats at a long table.

dialogues.speaker: PROCESSING CLERK
dialogues.text: We're getting OT right?

dialogues.speaker: PROCESSING CLERK
dialogues.text: Better be. ‘Cause we're gonna miss the god damn Giants game. Their equally pissed-off BOSS wheels in a huge mail bin.  oO

dialogues.speaker: PROCESSING CLERK
dialogues.text: Who we looking for?

dialogues.speaker: PROCESSING BOSS
dialogues.text: Some bitch named Ann Harrison. They start sorting through the huge mail bins. Tearing open the envelopes. Searching for Ann's policy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty is at the computer. Looking up "Paul Cabot." No rap sheet, no outstanding warrants.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Just a law-abiding citizen.

dialogues.speaker: BASTE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Detective. Marty looks up, sees Baste calling over to Alex.

dialogues.speaker: BULLPEN
dialogues.text: Baste holds a credit card receipt.

dialogues.speaker: BASTE
dialogues.text: Found it wedged under the seat of their car. It's a credit card receipt from a gas station-- Marty joins them.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (off receipt) "Paul Cabot?" (to Marty) Know him? Marty shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: BASTE
dialogues.text: (looks at phone records) No incoming or outgoing calls to a Cabot here.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Call the credit card company. See what they got. (to another Deputy) Check every motel and hotel in the area. The word "hotel" hits Marty.  Marty heads for the door. Starts to open the door... When it's opened from the outside. TWO MEN in cheap suits enter the station.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Chief Walsh?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (hesitantly) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Agent White. DEA. Marty smiles weakly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The processing clerks begin sorting through the mail bins

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five deputies are calling local motels and hotels... Working the phones like volunteers at a Jerry Lewis telet

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm looking for a Paul Cabot.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Name's Paul Cabot.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Cabot. Marty's talking with Agent White... As he helplessly watches the Deputies making their calls. Agent Fetzer is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: ... What do you want me to do?! The bank's closed!

dialogues.speaker: AGENT WHITE
dialogues.text: You were supposed to have the money here.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but we've been a little busy. We're trying to solve a murder here.  wo

dialogues.speaker: AGENT WHITE
dialogues.text: And we're trying to break up a drug cartel that murders hundreds of people. Now, how do I get into that bank?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: How 'bout robbing it? (beat) Listen, I'm sorry, it's my fuck-up.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT WHITE
dialogues.text: Tell me something I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I'm trying to apologize here... Agent Fetzer hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FETZER
dialogues.text: Stark said he's getting a warrant. Shouldn't be more than a couple hours. Marty flinches. Just a little. But anough.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT WHITE
dialogues.text: The money is in the bank, right Chief?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (laughs weakly) No, I stole it. I'm going to Costa Rica. You wanna come?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT WHITE
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) No thanks, I like the cold.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (picks up the phone) I'll call the manager at home again.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT WHITE
dialogues.text: 'Preciate that. We're gonna go grab something to eat. (beat) Some place close by. The DEA agents leave. As soon as they're gone, Marty runs for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: w Marty digs through the crap on the floor of his truck. Finally finds what he's looking for... The Ramada Inn hotel key he found outside Ann's house. He dials Ramada's number on his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: TY, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Paul Cabot's room. The call is put through. Marty hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty's breaking land speed records on his way to the hot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Deputy slams down the phone.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: (to Alex) There's a Cabot at the Ramada over in Amherst! Alex and Baste run to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty SLAMS the truck to a stop. Runs into the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Frieland (aka Paul Cabot) talks on the phone. (NOTE: We'll refer to him as Cabot from now on.)

dialogues.speaker: CABOT, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: I've already watched the god dam pay per view... (listens) Just get the god damn passports!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baste and Alex whip down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty's talking with the CLERK.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (holding room key) . Like a complete idiot I forgot what room I'm in. The Clerk nods sympathetically.  on oO

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Happens all the time, Mr. Cabot. I just need some ID.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, sure. Marty pulls out Cabot's hospital ID.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Wallet's in the room. The Clerk barely glances at the ID.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Room 215.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: ("remembering") 215. Yeah, that's it. Thanks. Marty heads for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cabot lays on the bed. He hears FOOTSTEPS stop outside the door. He perks up, listening intently.

dialogues.speaker: HOTEL HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Marty pauses outside Room 215. Draws his gun. Inserts the electronic key. It CLICKS open.

dialogues.speaker: HOTEL ROOM
dialogues.text: Marty BURSTS into the room. Probing everywhere with his gun... Cabot's nowhere to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Baste pass a sign reading: "Ramada Inn - Next Ex

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty bursts into the bathroom. Pulls back the shower curtain... Nothing. Starts checking the main room.

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: w Cabot bursts out of the closet. Tackles Marty, throws him onto the bed. Marty's gun flies out of his hand. Slides into the bathroom. CABOT: Jumps on Marty. Starts pummeling him... Raining punches down on Marty's face. MARTY: Pushes Cabot off of him with his legs. Cabot SLAMS into a wall. MARTY: Dives off the bed, searching for his gun. His hand darts under the bed, probing... CABOT: Recovers, grabs the bedside lamp. He throws the lamp at Marty's head. The lamp glances off Marty's head, dazing him. CABOT: Pulis Marty to his feet... Throws Marty into the bathroom. Marty bounces off the toilet and crumples to the ground. Cabot pulls the still-dazed Marty up by his neck. Starts choking him.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (gasping for air) Eeeee... MARTY'S FACE: Turning red... Marty claws at Cabot's face. CABOT: Tightening his hands around Marty's throat. MARTY: Works his hands down to Cabot's waist... And grabs his balls. Hard!

dialogues.speaker: CABOT
dialogues.text: Aaah! Cabot reflexively lets go of Marty. Writhes on the floor in pain. Marty stands there for a beat, dazed. Trying to suck in as much air as possible. Cabot notices Marty's gun on the bathroom floor. Reaches for it -- gets it. Staggers to his feet. Turns toward Marty. But he never gets a chance to shoot. Because Marty swings the top of the toilet at Cabot's hea The 15 lb. porcelain top hits Cabot's face at about 65 mp  o No And the laws of physics take over... Bones crack, teeth shatter, blood splatters... And Cabot falls backward into the bathtub...

dialogues.speaker: CYYYH
dialogues.text: His neck snaps as he hits the bottom of the tub head firs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police car passes a car as if the car was standing st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty, in a state of shock, stares at Cabot. He takes a couple deep breaths, tries to compose himself. He walks over to the sink. Hands shaking uncontrollably, he splashes water on his fa He looks at his reflection in the mirror. Not the same man he was this morning. He pauses, notices something in the mirror. He runs into the main room. Grabs a metal briefcase that's tucked next to the dresser Tries to open the briefcase, but it's locked. He fishes through Cabot's pockets. Finds a set of keys. Marty unlocks the briefcase, pops it open... The briefcase is stuffed with $100 bills.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Hello, Mr. Franklin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Baste are a hundred yards from the Ramada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty stumbles out of Cabot's room. Heads to the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police car screeches to a stop in front of the hotel. Alex hustles into the hotel. Baste right behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty walks out of the stairwell.  oo

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: See ya, Mr. Cabot. Marty ignores him and heads to the door. And then stops abruptly. He sees Alex, just about to enter the hotel. Alex is just about to see him when... Marty, turns, looks around... Searching for an escape. He sees the elevators and stairs. Walks/runs back across the lobby. The Clerk has noticed his quick "180." Alex and Baste walk in. Head for the Clerk. Marty is almost across the lobby. Marty gets to the stairs. Notices an Emergency Door leading outside. No good -- the alarm will give him away. ALEX AND THE CLERK: The Clerk points to the stairs. STAIRS: The door closes. Alex and Baste bolt for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: EAST STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: Marty takes the stairs two at a time. Not sure what to do. A couple floors below, footsteps POUND up the stairs. ALEX & BASTE: Rushing up the stairs. They can hear Marty a couple floors above. MARTY: Gets to the 4th floor. Throws open the door. Runs into...

dialogues.speaker: 4TH FLOOR HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Marty sprints down the hall, still clutching the briefcas

dialogues.speaker: LOBBY
dialogues.text: A couple Security GUARDS spread out.

dialogues.speaker: 4TH FLOOR HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Marty sprints down the hall, knocks over a cleaning cart.

dialogues.speaker: EAST STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: Alex and Baste come to the 4th floor. The door hasn't closed yet.  w he

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I'll take four. You keep going.

dialogues.speaker: 4TH FLOOR HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Alex runs down the hallway. The stairwell door at the other end of the hallway closes

dialogues.speaker: WEST STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: Marty jumps down the stairs, a half landing at a time... But then STOPS. Pauses for a beat... Stashes the briefcase against the wall. He catches his breath for a second. Hears the door open above him. He starts running up the stairs. Runs right into Alex, knocks her over.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What the--

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (labored breathing) I pulled in right after you.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: He come down--

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (shakes head) Nobody passed me. Alex considers this for a beat. Then turns, starts running up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I'll meet you in the lobby. Marty waits a beat, then heads down the stairs. Retrieves the briefcase. Cautiously makes his way down to the first floor. He opens the door and bumps right into... The Clerk! CLERK'S EYES: Instant recognition. MARTY'S EYES: Oh Shit!

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: (yelling) It's him! It's--

dialogues.speaker: LOBBY
dialogues.text: w ut Baste and a couple of Security Guards hear the Clerk. Run toward the stairs. Eh-eh-eh-eh-eh... The Emergency Alarm blares.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRS
dialogues.text: Baste and the Guards run over. The Emergency Door's open. The Clerk lies on the floor, unconscious. WIDEN TO REVEAL Marty standing above the Clerk. The briefcase isn't visible.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (points out door) Out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards burst out of the door. Run past a dumpster... Where the tip of the briefcase sticks out of the trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The unconscious clerk lies on a couch. Marty watches him nervously. He doesn't want to be here when the clerk wakes up. Baste walks in, gestures to Marty.

dialogues.speaker: BASTE
dialogues.text: She wants to see you upstairs. Marty follows Baste out. Marty catches a glimpse of his neck in a mirror. Pulls up his jacket to cover Cabot's handprints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops are busy dusting the room for fingerprints. CoP Prints are everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: How long 'til we can run ‘em?

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Couple hours. Marty goes over to where they're dusting for prints. "Accidentally" puts his hand down.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Chief!

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: ("noticing" his mistake Shit. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: (shaking head) That's alright. We'll just get a set of yours to disqualify.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Thanks. Marty heads over to Alex.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: {under his breath) Idiot. Alex is looking through Cabot's wallet.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (pointing to Cabot) This Cabot?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (shakes her head) It's one of 'em. The clerk pointed out Cabot when we came in.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: The guy we were chasing?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah. But that wasn't Cabot. (gestures to Cabot) Because Cabot was up here taking a bath.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: ("confused") So somebody was pretending they were Cabot?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That's what it seems like. We'll know more when the clerk wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: He looks like he's gonna be out for a while.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Ah, we'll get him some smelling salts. or something.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Excuse me here.  Marty and Alex step out of the cop's way.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I'm gonna head back. Alex nods as Marty starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: How'd you get here so fast?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: T, uh, heard it on the radio. Alex nods. Marty waits a beat, then leaves.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (into walkie talkie) Yeah, this is Alex. Did anybody put it over the radio that we were heading to the hotel? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think I heard Billy mention it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (INTO WALKIE-TALKIE)
dialogues.text: (smiling) Thanks. (sotto; sing-song) Paranoid.

dialogues.speaker: RIP... RIP...
dialogues.text: The Processing Clerks have multiplied to eight now. They're halfway through the mail bin.

dialogues.speaker: PROCESSING CLERK
dialogues.text: Hey, you know what? This chick lives in Michigan, right? (beat) We should just be looking for envelopes with Michigan postmarks. This epiphany sinks in for a beat.  o oo

dialogues.speaker: PROCESSING CLERK
dialogues.text: Shit, you're right.

dialogues.speaker: PROCESSING CLERK
dialogues.text: (excited) Giants game at my house! They laugh as they dig in, energized.

dialogues.speaker: PROCESSING CLERK
dialogues.text: We should be done in an hour. (beat) You, my friend, are middle management material. They just glance at the envelopes, checking the postmark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty talks to Chae on the phone as he looks out the wind The unconscious Clerk is loaded into an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: So you killed your only suspect? Well, not exactly the way I would try and prove my innocence--

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (rubbing his temples) It was self-defense.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: But you got the money, right?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: Well get the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I told you. I'm not running. Marty starts to pull out. KNOCK~ KNOCK. Marty stops, looks out the window. Alex throws open the passenger door and jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Going my way? Marty hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty drives.  oo wo Alex stares out the window. Notices a diner up the road.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (pointing to diner) Lemme buy you a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: For the bang-up job you're doing.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (skeptical) You want to stop for a cup of coffee now?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I need-my fix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty and Alex sit across from each other in a booth. Nei say anything for a long beat. Marty keeps stealing looks Alex, trying to figure out if she knows or suspects that involved.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Is this how the Sheriff's department recommends solving murders now?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Sometimes it helps me to step away for a couple minutes. (beat) Though I do have an ulterior motive.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: And I thought you just had a thing for bad coffee.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It's not that bad. (beat, takes a sip) Actually, it is pretty awful. She pushes the coffee away.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I just wanted you to know, at that conference--  wo

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Listen, I'm sorry I never called you--

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No, No. That's not what I mean. I just wanted you to know, I'm usually not that... forward.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Except on the second date, right?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That was a slight exaggeration to make you feel stupid for not calling me. Alex smiles at him. And in spite of the day he's had, Mar smiles back at her.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Did it work?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Depends on how slight of an exaggeration it was. Alex smiles coyly.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: It didn't need to work. Right now, I'm thinking not calling you was pretty much the stupidest thing I ever did. Alex blushes, touched. And Marty is speaking the truth. A he can see in Alex is the road not taken. And unlike Robe Frost, he regrets the hell out of his choice.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Now if you said something like that at the hotel, you wouldn't have had to wait for the second date.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: My kingdom for a time machine. A beat. Then Alex slams the table in mock anger.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: So why the hell didn't you call me?! (he doesn't answer) Were you seeing somebody else? Marty considers how much he should tell her. After a bea he nods.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: It started right after I met you.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (afraid to ask) You still seeing her?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: {laughs wearily) No. No, it's definitely over.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Well, actually I'm not. I mean-- (quickly to cover) Did it end badly?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (another weary laugh) Yeah, you could say that. Alex reaches over, takes Marty's hand. She thinks his wea laugh is a way to mask the pain. Marty looks down at her hand on top of his. Can't help thinking of the last woman who comforted him. But when he looks up at Alex's eyes he sees something he never saw in Ann's -- genuine affection The moment is interrupted by Alex's ringing cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yeah... (listens for a beat) We're on our way. Alex snaps her phone shut.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That was Baste. Our buddy Cabot made some calls from the hotel before he went to Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (excited) To who?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: They're not sure. Phone company's trying to run the numbers right now. Marty tries to control his excitement. He's not done yet, not with Cabot's calls as a possible lead.  w is

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: We should probably get back. ty stands up, throws a $5 bill on the table. He and Alex head for the door.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: So, after this thing is over, you think you'd want to go out?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (points to $5 bill on tabie) ong as this counts as our sl rst date. Mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lex punches him good naturedly. She gets to the door fir Marty pushes past her, makes a big production out of ope: the door for her. Alex makes an equaily big production of walking out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty's truck pulls into the parking lot. He squeezes into his parking spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex tries to open her door, but she can't. Marty has parked too close to another car.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Pretty subtle.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Your parking job. (beat) Did you really think I was gonna crawl over you to get out?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Oh, yeah. That was my plan. Alex pushes Marty toward his door.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Why don't we go solve this thing? (beat, smiles) Then maybe I'll crawl over you. Marty hops out. Alex slides over to his door. A Post-It note from the floor sticks to her shoe. Alex jumps out.  They start to walk toward the station. Alex stops, mocices a Post-It stuck to the bottom of her Marty, oblivious, heads into the station. Alex grabs the Post-it. It reads -- "I'm sorry. Love, A" She stares at the Post-It for a long beat. Wondering what we already know -- that the note is from A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex walks in, looking distracted. The place is buzzing with excitement. Everyone knows they're close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex looks over at Marty in his office. He catches her and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The processing clerks fly through the mail bin. The bin is almost empty.

dialogues.speaker: PROCESSING CLERK
dialogues.text: Kick-off's in half an hour! They kick it up a notch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex talks to a Deputy.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I want you to go over to the dentist's office. See if you can find something with Ann's handwriting on it. The Deputy nods and takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pressure is taking its toll on Marty. Alex walks into his office.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Hey, any word on those phone calls?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: They should have them soon.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Good. Alex watches him -- one thought running through her head.  Did he do it?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Oh, and the hospital just called. The clerk just woke up. He should be here in like half an hour. Alex watches his reaction -- did he wince?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: reat.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Listen, I know it's premature. But I just wanted to let you know something about me.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Honesty is really important to me. They stare at each other for a long beat. As they speak, neither breaks the stare.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Honesty, huh?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I've been burned before by guys who weren't--

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Honest with you?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (nods) I dated a guy for three months before I found out he was married.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I'm not married.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: So, I just wanted you to know, if there's anything going on with you and your old girlfriend, please tell me now. Their eyes bore into each other. Each waiting for the other to break the stare.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: ‘Cause I'll understand. Just don't lie to me. ‘Cause I'll eventually find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty e@ Take his Alex continues staring at him. After a beat, she turns and leaves. Marty watches her as she walks into the bullpen.

dialogues.speaker: BULLPEN
dialogues.text: She walks over to the Deputy she sent to the dentist's.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Did you find anything?

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: -tshakes his head) Sorry. Alex walks over to Baste.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Get me the phone records and credit card statements for the = Chief. Him?

dialogues.speaker: BAST
dialogues.text: (gestures to Marty) Alex nods and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Marty sees the look Baste gives him. He turns away. Stares out the window. Catches his reflection. And his reflection tells him what he already knows... He's too tired to keep up this charade. He starts for the door. His phone rings. He pauses a beat, then answers it.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Chief Walsh. rd] A long pause on the other line.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Hello?  we ov

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Oh, Marty... Oh, thank Marty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARTY'S FACE: What?! His knees buckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amn sits on the floor of a cabin. Her clothes are stained with blood. She looks awful.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Oh, Marty-- It's... {sobbing} I'm so sorry. I'm so sorry. [It was never--

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (beat) This is a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: (sobbing) Oh, Marty. There's so much I have to-- Marty. I need to--

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: You've got a lot of people worried around here, Ann. See, we all got the funny idea that you were dead.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: I... I'm so sorry. I'm so sorry...

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: What about Chris? Ann looks over to her right... Chris is laying on the floor, dead.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: I, I killed him. I told him I was going back to you... I didn't care what happened to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty stands there frozen, listening. Every fiber in him wants to believe Ann.

dialogues.speaker: BULLPEN
dialogues.text: Alex watches Marty.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: He and Cabot planned it. They got the bodies from the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: And you switched the dental records?

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: I had to... He was going to kill me if I didn't go along with it. And I was so scared to tell you. I was scared you wouldn't forg me... And every day I didn't tell you was another day I fell more in love with you. (NOTE: Cut between Marty's office and Ann.) MARTY'S FACE: Softening just a bit. What if she's telling the truth?

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Another day I couldn't stand the thought of you leaving me. So I figured, okay, I'll do it. Chris and Cabot would get the money. But you'd get the insurance money. And you'd be able to replace the money you borrowed. And then, maybe, maybe, when you found out I wasn't dead, you might somehow, I don't know, forgive me...

dialogues.speaker: BULLPEN
dialogues.text: Alex grabs the sketch of "Marty." Now she is seeing the similarities instead of differences

dialogues.speaker: MARTY'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: MARTY: Still on the phone. The logical and emotional sides of his brain at war. Can she be telling the truth? Marty looks out. Alex is watching him intently. He sees the sketch in her hands. They lock eyes for a beat. Marty looks away.  we a

dialogues.speaker: ON PHONE
dialogues.text: Marcy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . We can st @ Just like we stares out at the bullpen. 1 the people working feverishly to uncover him.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: What about the money?

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: I, I don't know. Cabot has it, I think But I don't care about the money. I never did. I just care about you. Marty is actually buying it.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Please... let ju MARTY: Agonizing over the hardest decision of his life.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (looks outside) a Shit. @ MARTY'S POV: Robert, the viatical salesman, hops out of

dialogues.speaker: MARTY, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Gimme your number.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Gimme your number. ‘Cause when I call you back, I'm gonna need you to pick me up so we can get the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert walks to the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty walks/runs out of his office. Heads for the bathroom. He passes right by Robert, who is just entering the stati Marty opens the bathroom. Or rather... tries. It's locked. ROBERT: Looks around, sees the back of Marty's head. Starts to approach Marty.  w 0

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Excuse me? MARTY: Ignores Robert. He BANGS on the bathroom door, quietly, but insistently. The toilet FLUSHES on the other side of the door. Marty's praying they're not going to wash their hands. But they obviously practice good hygiene... We hear the CREAKING pipes as the FAUCET is turned on.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Excuse me? Marty pretends not to hear. Robert taps Marty on the shoulder ALEX: Hangs up the phone. Sees Robert. The bathroom door opens. A Deputy walks out. Marty quickly jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Marty locks the stall. Pulls out his cell phone - dials 411.

dialogues.speaker: AUTOMATED 411 VOICE
dialogues.text: City and listing, please.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Detroit. Living Gift. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: AUTOMATED 411 VOICE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I didn't understand that. City and listing, please.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: You gotta be fucking kidding me. (beat; over-enunciates) Detroit. Living Gift. And he waits...

dialogues.speaker: BULLPEN
dialogues.text: Alex is seated across from Robert. And she is very interested in what he has to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: un port this afternoon, saying that Ann and her husband had died sometime last night.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: And you're sure 3 husband this morni

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Yes, around eleven-chi

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: {to Baste) Where's Marty?

dialogues.speaker: BASTE
dialogues.text: I think he just went in the can.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Marty's talking on his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Listen, I need his cell phone number. (listens) Okay, okay. Thank you. He hangs up, dials Robert's cell phone number. Knock-knock.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hey, you almost done in there? I need you for a sec.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY, (TO DOOR)
dialogues.text: Just finishing up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert's cell phone sits on the passenger seat, RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert scrutinizes the sketch.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Could be him, yeah, I mean, eyes were closer together, face was a little fuller, and he was balder. But yeah, that's probably him. Alex nods, satisfied. She heads into Marty's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARTY: On the cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Hi, you've reached Robert Guilette-- Marty hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Alex digs around his desk. Throws open the drawer. Finds what she's looking for -- a photo of Marty.

dialogues.speaker: BULLPEN
dialogues.text: Alex comes over to Robert. -— DEPUTY (0.S.) Excuse me, Mr. Guilette. Your office is on line one. Robert grabs a phone as Alex reaches him.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: You know who this is, right? Robert does.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I've got ten thousand dollars in cash if you forget you ever met me. A long beat as Robert digests this. Alex hands Robert a photo of Marty.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Ten grand, cash. You'll have it in ten minutes. ROBERT: Trying to decide.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Is that her husband? ROBERT: Looking at the photo, listening to Marty.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Twenty grand...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: What wi picture... the phone... be: civic duty or cash?

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Tell them we can't close the deal for less than twenty-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Done. Tell them answer in off

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Just keep talking once I hang up.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: (to Alex; re: photo) I'm sorry, this isn't him.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Marty hangs up the phone. He walks out of the bathroom nonchalantly.

dialogues.speaker: BULLPEN
dialogues.text: Marty heads over to Alex and Robert.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: No, I should be finished here soon.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (to Alex) Sorry. It's all this coffee. What's up? Robert "finishes" up his call. He turns to Marty. Stares at him blankly for a beat. ALEX: Watches Robert for a reaction. None.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Who's this? Alex looks on, surprised. She was so sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Robert Gui talked to Ann abo insurance policy. He, uh, buying her

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Really? Any idea who she had as the beneficiary?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Her husband. Marty nods, looks to Alex. Marty notices his photo on the table. He picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: How'd this get out here? Marty scoops up the photsc, starts for his office. He stops at Tony's desk. Starts looking around the desk for something. A totally deflated Alex finishes up with Robert.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Well, give me a call if you remember anything else. Robert shakes hands with Alex and leaves. Alex goes over to Baste.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Get me my hotel clerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clerk, still groggy, is loaded into a police car. They pull out, sirens blaring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two DEA Agents pass a sign, “Welcome to Quicho."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Processing Clerk #1 jumps out of his seat. He's clutching Ann's insurance policy.

dialogues.speaker: PROCESSING CLERK
dialogues.text: I got it! He does a victory lap. High-fives his buddies as they all hoot and holler.  Giants: Gian

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty watches Alex. When she is in a blind spot, he hurries out o Walks into the bathroom. th ey be wo oO rt h wy a o

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Marty locks the door. Opens the window. Jumps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty hits the ground. He duck-walks to his truck. Hops in the bed. Pries open the window to the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex stands over the fax machine. In the f.g. we see Marty crawling into the cab of his tru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty crawls back out to the bed of his truck. He's dragging the metallic briefcase with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex grabs something off the fax machine. Looks around the police station. Notices Marty's not there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty runs down the street to Robert's car.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Where's my money? Marty hands him a stack of $100 bills.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Another five for a ride?

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Get in.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Pop the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex walks over to Baste.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Where's Marty? wy

dialogues.speaker: BAST
dialogues.text: I don't know. Check the batt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baste walks over tc the bathroom. Tries the door: Locked.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Detective. It's somebody from the insurance company. Alex grabs the phone. Listens for a long beat. She drops the phone. Runs to the bathroom. Kicks the door. The lock SNAPS. She runs in.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert's car rips down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Total chaos. Deputies scurry around like the proverbial chickens sans But Alex is calm and focused -- the eye of the storm. Totally confident she's going to nail the guy who betraye

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I want roadblocks set up at a twenty mile perimeter. Get the state police on all the major highways... The door opens. DEA Agents White and Fetzer walk in.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: for Chief Walsh. We're look

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (laughs) Well you sure as hell came to the right place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cop car pulls up behind Robert's car. Hits the sirens and pulls Robert over.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: {calling out) They just pulled that guy over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cop talks to a very nervous Robert.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: (to Robert) Pop the trunk, sir. Robert pops his trunk. The cop goes over to the trunk... It's empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty sprints through the woods. He clutches the briefcase as he talks to Ann on his cell

dialogues.speaker: MARTY, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Meet me at the Gower's old place on Pond Road.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: I'll be there in ten minutes. Marty stops running. Catches his breath. Looks at the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: They found the money.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: The Sarcetti money.

dialogues.speaker: ANN, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: I don't care about the money. Ann stares at the floor. The floor is littered with thousands of $1 bills. And a smattering of $100 bills.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: i've got the money with me. amongst the $i ON a money-colored piece o 1 place. Love, OF PAPER: "Don't spend

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: I don't care about the money... Ann picks up a stack of "$100" bills. Thumbs it. oa And we see how Chris fucked her...

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: I never cared about the money.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Well, you better start caring about it. (beat) You should get going.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: I love you...

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I love you, too. Ann hangs up the phone. She steps over Chris's dead body. Walks over to the dresser. Stares into the mirror for a beat. Takes a deep breath. And then... She SMASHES her face down on the dresser.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: (blood curdling) Ahhhhhh! Ann nearly passes out from the pain. She checks herself in the mirror... A mean black eye starts to form. Ann smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex paces as she talks to DEA Agent Whit

dialogues.speaker: AGENT WEITE
dialogues.text: He was supposed to have it here when we got back.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT WEITE
dialogues.text: Almost seven hundred thousand. Alex shakes her head in disbelief. Beep-beep... beep-beep...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Shut that up! Beep-beep... beep-beep...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that?! Beep-beep... beep~beep. Everybody looks around for the source of the alarm. Then Alex sees it -- it's Tony's Palm. She smiles as she grabs it. The alarm reads: "Mom's Birthday." But Alex doesn't bother with the alarm. She finds the GPS application.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty emerges out of the woods. Runs over to an abandoned house. Marty throws open the door. Runs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex works the GPS application on Tony's Palm. A map of Quicho appears. Alex finds the "locate" option. A list pops up: “Locate who? -- Chief, Ambulance, Fire De Alex selects "Chief." After a beat, a blinking dot appears on the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann breezes past a road block on the other side of the ro She passes a sign: "WELCOME TO QUICHO."  va

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty checks his gun. Then snaps the gun shut. Puts it on the hall table. And then does the only thing he can do... Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex runs out of the station, clutching Tony's Palm. She jumps into a police car. The car rips out of the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann guns the car down the dirt road. Passes the deputies who are doing the house to house sear She turns on to Pond Road. She starts "crying."

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: (into rear view mirror) I'm so sorry, Marty... (more "pain") I'm so sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann stops a couple of houses down from Marty's safe house She looks around, checking for an ambush. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty stares out. Sees Ann walking up toward the house. Ke smiles, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann hurries to the house, cautious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex stares at the Palm. They're getting closer to the blinking dot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann walks in the house. Marty stares at her for a long beat, overwhelmed. As she gets closer, he notices her swollen eye. She starts crying.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry...  softl Don't. Don't She melts into his arms. He hugs her tightly. His eyes -- tearing up. All doubt washing away. Her eyes -- cold. Scanning the room for the money. She notices his gun laying on the table. He breaks the hug. Looks into her eyes... Which gaze at him, full of love.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I was worried you weren't going to come .

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: I was worried you wouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I wasn't about to lose you twice. He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: We should get going.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (smiles) First day of the rest of our lives, right?

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Right. He starts for the door. After a couple of steps, he notices she's not following. He turns around... Ann is facing him, his gun in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: What's that saying? Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me--

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Where's the money, Marty?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I thought it didn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann pulls the trigger... CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Whocps... No bullets. Marty takes a step toward Ann.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: It's over, Ann. Ann drops his gun to the floor. And pulls her gun out of her jacket.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Whoops... A lot of bullets. She aims it at Marty and smiles. _ Marty freezes -- he wasn't expecting this.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Slr ene et

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: She shoots him in the leg. Marty falls to the floor, writhing in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Baste are a hundred yards away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty stares at the blood pouring out of his leg. Then looks up at Ann, who stands over him, gun extended.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Where is it? Marty doesn't answer. Ann aims the gun at his head. Slowly draws the gun's hammer back...

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. (beat) It's in the closet. Ann cautiously walks over to the closet. Opens it. The briefcase is in there.  She pulls it out. ries to open it. e@ But it's locked.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Where's the key?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I swallowed it.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: (smiles) Well, I guess I can afford to pay a locksmith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann walks over to Marty. Stands above him. Points the gun at his head. The only thing colder than the gun barrel are Ann's eyes. GUN'S HAMMER: Cocks back. Starts to go forward...

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: A beat as time stands still. Then Ann staggers for a couple steps. And crashes to the floor. @ Revealing... A window with a bullet hole behind her. Alex is on the other side of the window, her gun still dr Marty looks over to Ann. A pool of blood forms around her. Alex bursts through the door, gun still drawn. Marty smiles up at her.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Ah... There's my knight in shi armor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex doesn't even acknowledge him. She kicks Ann's gun across the floor. Checks her pulse. Nothing. Finally, she looks over to Marty. But she's not smiling.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You almost got away with it. eS MARTY Got away with what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty lowers his head. Doesn't say anything. She tosses Tony's Palm to him. Marty stares at the Palm for a beat. Alex takes out her handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: You're not serious. She points her gun at him.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You want a matching hole in your other leg? Marty holds out his hands. She cuffs him. Grabs the briefcase. Tries to open it.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Here. Marty fishes the key out of his pocket. She takes it. Opens the briefcase. Her eyes widen in surprise. BRIEFCASE: Full of newspapers. And sitting on top of the newspapers... Marty's Palm -- the GPS application active.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Do you know if Tony called his mother to wish her happy birthday? He's always forgetting...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (dawning on her) You wanted me to find you. Marty nods.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Sure. We've got a second date, remember?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't take the chance that you wouldn't believe me. That you wouldn't let me come and meet Ann. Alex stares at the whole scene for a long beat -- Ann's b the briefcase of newspapers, then finally Marty. He grine at her.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: So the money's back at the station?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat; defensive} Where else wouid it be?

dialogues.speaker: AT. POLICE STATION
dialogues.text: m Chae climbs out of Marty's truck, carrying 4 grocery bag. The bag is full cf the evidence money. Chae walks into the police station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chae walks in. Nobody is here -- they're all trying to find marty. Chae goes into Marty's office and opens the evidence safe He stares at the money, then at the evidence safe.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: (to himself} He's your friend... He looks at the money, then at the evidence safe.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: {to himself) A good friend. He picks up a stack of cash. Smells it. CHAE. (to himself) But not your best friend. Chae's cell phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yeah.
ov

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Everything work out alright?

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: What? You don’t trust me?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Nah, I trust you. I just know you.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: (sighs) It would've been a good boat. Chae hangs up. Then, with a heavy heart, he puts the money back into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty snaps his cell phone shut. Alex looks down at his bleeding leg.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: We should get you to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Maybe just a band-aid. Marty tries to stand up. He falls down from the pain.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Or we could go to the hospital. Alex helps him to his feet. She slings his arm around her shoulder and ushers him out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: And on the way, why don't you fill in a couple hundred details I'm missing? You know, for my report. Alex smiles sweetly at him.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Well, it started a couple months ago. (beat) Actually, it started six months ago. (beat) No, no, that's not right either. (takes a deep breath) It all started in high school...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the kind of place you see on a postcard. Blue water white beaches as far as the eye can see. Marty and Alex sit in a small boat. Marty's fishing over side. His leg still bandaged. Alex is soaking up rays.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: {checks her watch) Our flight's in four hours.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: A week's not long enough.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Well, if it's any consolation, my mom said we got a foot of snow last night.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Can't wait to get back. Marty starts up the motor and heads into shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty and Alex walk hand-in-hand up the beach to a small

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: You think we have time for some second date before we have to leave for the airport? Alex kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty and Alex walk inside. A white-as-a-ghost Chae sits a chair wearing a gaudy Hawaiian shirt.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (without missing a beat) Nice shirt.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: I think it works. Marty starts laughing.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: What the hell you doing here? Chae hands him a stack of mail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) You flew down here to bring me my mail?

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: I didn't want you to to ruin your credit by being late with your electric bill. Marty looks at the mail. Most of it, including his Publisher's Clearinghouse Sweepstakes envelope, has been opened already.

dialogues.speaker: CHAE
dialogues.text: (re: opened mail) Long flight. Marty flips through the mail. Stops at one envelope. Pulls a piece of paper out of the envelope. Well, actually it's a check.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Is everything okay.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I think we're way past okay here. It's a check for $1,000,000 from Equity Life Insurance Company. The lower left corner of the check reads, "Polic # 116423 - Ann Harrison."
